thread.title: Cameron Dallas Joins the Cast of Social Media Stars at Dolce & Gabbana
thread.title_full: Cameron Dallas Joins the Cast of Social Media Stars at Dolce & Gabbana

author: Janelle Okwodu
title: Cameron Dallas Joins the Cast of Social Media Stars at Dolce & Gabbana
text:
Photo: Yannis Vlamos / Indigital.tv See more photos of: 
If there was any doubt about Dolce & Gabbana ’s commitment to the Snapchat generation, it was put to rest at the brand’s Fall 2017 menswear show . The cast, largely comprised of Internet stars and celebrity children, provided the collection with several social media–worthy moments. With Cameron Dallas as the opener in a black and burgundy suit, Sistine and Sophia Stallone fresh from their stint as Miss Golden Globes, and pop star Austin Mahone providing the soundtrack, the event focused on the power of youth. The idea of real people—or at least those deemed cool enough to warrant the hashtag #DGMillenials—underscored the lineup, with notables from all segments of the entertainment industry getting their chance to shine. Chinese heartthrob Chen Xue Dong, actor Avan Jogia, and British rapper Tinie Tempah all modeled tailored looks, while Sofia Richie, Sonia Ben Ammar, and Imogen Waterhouse showed off fanciful womenswear. Lucky Blue Smith was united with his photogenic sisters Pyper America and Starlie Cheyenne, and Presley Gerber returned to the Dolce & Gabbana runway for the second menswear season in a row. 
In featuring so many of the world’s most-followed on their runway, the Italian brand all but ensures that it’ll be the recipient of countless likes and clicks in the coming days. Dallas’s runway debut alone would have been newsworthy, but the combined reach of the attractive teens and 20-somethings fits with Dolce & Gabbana’s new “break the Internet” casting ethos. Their band of influential beauties also fit well with the collection’s other overarching theme: royalty.
